Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the Civil Code allows a civil claim to be made for pecuniary and non - pecuniary damage arising from the unlawful actions of investigating authorities or courts in the context of a criminal case . The provision envisages compensation for an unlawful conviction , an unlawful arrest or detention , the application of unlawful procedural measures of enforcement , or an unlawful administrative penalty . According to recent domestic case - law , this provision may also allow claims for damages arising from the excessive length of criminal proceedings .
